comment: Dr. Glover is so nice! She answers all of your questions and truly wants to help. If you stay persistent on trying to schedule a meeting, she will always get back to you and make sure you understand what you need to do. Amazing teacher!
literally doesnt grade anything

She was one of the worst communicators I have ever had as a teacher. She never responded to emails or any concerns and really leaves the class up to dry if you have any actual questions. The material wasn't hard but not having the right book for the class didn't help since she posted the wrong edition in the beginning of the semester.

I really enjoyed taking Perception with Dr. Glover. This class was fully online for me, but I loved how organized she set it up. There are 4 tests, weekly quizzes and concept checks, 5 labs, and a couple projects. If you put effort into the labs and concept checks, you should do fine. Tests and quizzes were open book/note.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Her powerpoints were fine and provided good information, but if you're looking to get feedback on your assignments do not take her. Assigns too many things and then doesn't have time to grade them until the very end when there is no time to improve your grade. You don't know if you're doing assignments right or wrong and can't learn what's right.

This class is relatively easy. Made up of: 10 modules, a few quizzes in each module, 4 exams throughout the semester, concept checks weekly (come from powerpoints), & lab worksheet bi-weekly (come from book). Can finish a weeks worth of work in one day (2-3 hours). Exams aren't bad, make sure you do study guides. Take this over PSYC4455 any day.

Took her for online in the summer only problem is she didn't respond to any e-mails. like at all, you teach yourself, but its not too hard. I would take her again, but her no helping or answering any questions throughout the semester was irritating. She also grades very slowly.
4 exams based on book. 2 simple projects. weekly homework/labs. If you read the book and look at the extra material she has posted you will do well. shes friendly and wants you to succeed.
Dr. Glover was very flexible and clear on grading. A lot of assignments but as long as you keep up with them and do the reading, you'll be fine.

dr Glover is cool and i liked her teaching style cuz it was easy to follow. she teaches hybrids cuz she does research too so dont wait till the last minute for help cuz emailing can be slow. agree with post below ta just ok agree has an attitude but can help sometimes
Love this class! Dr. Glover is the best, she is really busy so make sure to ask for help in advance or you won't keep up and have to deal with the ta instead

The class started out fine, but got more unorganized and she had to redo the syllabus twice. The grading was unclear and mostly late; there was never a good explanation to big assignments. Her lectures were just her reading the powerpoint which is online. I found myself questioning her teaching method. She does help you if you need it though.

I love Dr. Glover! Physio was made really easy with her! She had study guides for the tests and the tests were exactly like the study guides. I know she primarily teaches perception, but physio was great with her. My favorite class this semester!

Dr. Glover is awesome! She makes class so much fun! I was nervous about taking physio, but after taking it with Dr. Glover, it is easily one of my favorite classes I have ever taken. If you study the concept checks from each module, you will do great!

Dr. Glover is a very nice person, but not a great professor, in my opinion. She's helpful and willing to listen, but also very unorganized and sometimes very unclear about what she expects. I definitely wouldn't recommend taking her as a hybrid course - lectures are very long and hard to follow. TA was not helpful at all and had an attitude.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very nice lady and an interesting, doable class.  Grading criteria is very clear.  Coming to class and participating in all of the easy activities is 75% of it, the rest is on your own which is great for a course with tough content.  She makes great study guides, helpful quizzes, and she lets the class decide some of the content covered.  Take her!

LOVE Dr. Glover she is one of my favorite professors, EVER! She cares about her students and is always willing to work with folks who ask! You have to show up, she is big on participation, easy A! Her class material can be super tough, but she makes it fun, interesting and more easy to learn with her easygoing nature and interesting labs!
Great prof. Do the reading and ask questions. Tests are pretty easy.

She is very organized and explains what is expected throughout the semester.  Read the book, quizzes and test are from the reading.  All quizzes and test are announced.  She always has time to speak with you and will explain everything in a clear and easy way to understand. If you attend class and do the reading you will succeed in the class.

She is unorganized, and a bit sporadic. She cancelled class quite a bit and then expected us to stay on track. She promised  us feedback on our proposals and we never got any. We basically had to do the work in the dark. She tends to have typos on her exams within the answers so that was confusing. She is nice, and approachable though.

The material in the class is hard, so be prepared to read thoroughly. Her review packets are just like the tests. STUDY THE IN CLASS REVIEW PACKETS HARDER THAN THE ONLINE POSTED REVIEW. She will produce questions directly from it. Do all extra credit. Do all lab write ups. Those two thing will get you an easy A in her class.

Take her! Might want to get book, it could clarify some stuff. She totally made this class easier than she could have. If you tell her you can't do something by the due date she will almost always let you turn it in late. Not strict on attendance. Just read the material and it's an easy A!
